links.*: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Pearl and Sir Orfeo
The Lord of the Rings: Rise to War
The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
The Lord of the Rings Online: Fate of Gundabad

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[3 January|3]]''' - [[Birthday Toast#Tolkien Society tradition|Birthday Toast]].
* '''[[12 January|12]]''' - A synopsis for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' series is released.
* '''[[23 January|23]]''' - ''[[Tolkien and the Classical World]]'' is published.
* '''[[25 January|25]]''' - ''[[Tolkien's Modern Reading]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 287]]'' is published.

==February==
* '''[[13 February|13]]''' - [[The Tolkien Society]] Seminar on the theme of "Twenty-first Century Receptions of Tolkien" is held online due to the [[wikipedia:COVID-19 pandemic|Covid-19 pandemic]].

==March==
* '''[[18 March|18]]''' - A new illustrated edition of ''[[The Silmarillion]]'' is published.
* '''[[25 March|25]]''' - [[Tolkien Reading Day]].

==April==
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 288]]'' is published.

==May==
* '''[[10 May|10]]''' - [[Houghton Mifflin Harcourt|Houghton Miffin]] is bought by [[HarperCollins]].
* '''[[27 May|27]]''' - A new paperback edition of ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Pearl and Sir Orfeo#2020 Deluxe edition|Sir Gawain and the Green Knight: with Pearl and Sir Orfeo]]'' is published.

==June==
* '''[[10 June|10]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim]]'' is officially announced.
* '''[[10 June|10]]''' - ''[[The Science of Middle-earth (2021 book)|The Science of Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 289]]'' is published.

==July==
* '''[[3 July|3]] - [[4 July|4]]''' - [[The Tolkien Society]] Seminar on the theme of "Tolkien and Diversity" is held online due to the [[wikipedia:COVID-19 pandemic|Covid-19 pandemic]].
* '''[[29 July|29]]''' - ''[[Switzerland in Tolkien's Middle-Earth]]'' is published.

==August==
* '''[[3 August|3]]''' - Filming for the first season of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' is wrapped.
* '''[[10 August|10]]''' - ''[[Tolkien Calendar 2022]]'' is published.
* '''[[19 August|19]]''' - ''[[The Gallant Edith Bratt]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 290]]'' is published.

==September==
* '''[[2 September|2]]''' - ''[[The Nature of Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''[[2 September|2]] - [[5 September|5]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2021]] held online and at [https://www.st-annes.ox.ac.uk/ St Anne's College, Oxford].
* '''[[16 September|16]]''' - A new audiobook of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' narrated by [[Andy Serkis]] is released digitally.
* '''[[23 September|23]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Rise to War]]'' is released online.

==October==
* '''[[14 October|14]]''' - A new edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is published, including for the first time 30 images and sketches by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].
* '''[[14 October|14]]''' - A new audiobook of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' narrated by [[Andy Serkis]] is released physically.
* '''[[30 October|30]]''' - [[Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game]]: Fall of the Necromancer is released.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 291]]'' is published.

==November==
* '''[[6 November|6]]''' - [[The Tolkien Society]] Seminar on the theme of "Translating and Illustrating Tolkien" is held online due to the [[wikipedia:COVID-19 pandemic|Covid-19 pandemic]].
* '''[[10 November|10]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online: Fate of Gundabad]]'' expansion is released.
* '''[[11 November|11]]''' - ''[[Pictures by J.R.R. Tolkien]]'' is republished.

==December==
* '''[[2 December|2]]''' - British actor [[Antony Sher]] dies.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 292]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Mallorn 62]]'' is publsihed.
{{years|2017|2018|2019|2020|2021|2022|2023}}
